newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-SCOTLAND WIN 2-0 TO OPEN UP COMMANDING LEAD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SCOTLAND WIN 2-0 TO OPEN UP COMMANDING LEAD.

text.p: Blackburn's Kevin Gallacher scored twice as Scotland opened up a commanding seven point lead in World Cup qualifying group four by beat Austria 2-0 on Wednesday.
Gallacher scored his first international goal for three and a half years to put the Scots ahead after 24 minutes at a blustery Celtic Park.
He then swept home a spectacular volley from the edge of the area late in the second half before leaving the pitch before the final whistle to a standing ovation from the 43,295-strong crowd.
Scotland have yet to concede a goal in their six World Cup matches to date. They lead the group on 14 points from Austria, who have seven points from two fewer matches.
But Scotland manager Craig Brown refused to accept a place in the World Cup finals was a formality.

"We have still four games to go and there's a lot of football to be played," he said. "Though we fully deserved to beat Austria tonight they're not out of it. They could afford to lose this one and qualify. If we had lost we'd have had problems."
Brown described his side's performance as their most controlled of the campaign.

"We have been developing a European style of play and we're getting better at keeping possession," he said. "I was delighted for Kevin Gallacher who has suffered two broken legs in his career. He deserved the goals he got."
On 24 minutes a superb flick from Gallacher to Darren Jackson, who was in full flight down the left flank, had the white-shirted Austrians in retreat.
Jackson's shot was blocked by goalkeeper Michael Konsel but Jackson then managed to knock the rebound across goal for Gallacher to score.
Scotland's second goal came from another piece of combination play in the 77th minute.
Paul Lambert pushed forward on the right flank and his cross reached Gallacher, whose powerful volley swerved past Konsel into the far corner.
Austrian manager Herbert Prohaska said: "Scotland are now in the best position but I think things are still in the balance as they've got to go to Sweden and Sweden have still to come to Vienna."
